data.value: intensity of forgetting information by preadepts

data.name: label21.Text

data.name: label22.Text
data.value: The model of information dissemination in society is described by the following system of differential equations:

data.name: label23.Text
label24.Text
data.value: The computer model can be used to simplify the process of analyzing the dissemination of information in society and to determine the content characteristics, the management of which can stimulate the dissemination of information in the direction necessary for the participant (Acceleration or deceleration of the dissemination of information in society). The developed model allows you to set the parameters of social community (the number of groups 1 and 2- N1 and N2) and the characteristics of the dissemination of information flows (coefficients of the intensity of dissemination through the media and through interpersonal communication, intensity of “forgetting information" by preadepts and adepts). Based on this information , the user receives information about the dynamics of information dissemination over time, i.e. the number of "adherents" X1 and X2 "predadepts" x1 and x2 at a specific time; The main window of the program can be divided into 2 parts: Model parameters. In this part, the main parameters of the computer model are set: the number of groups 1 and 2 (N1, N2), the intensity coefficients of propagation through internal and external channels, as well as the intensity of “forgetting" information preadepts and adepts. Chart. In this area, a graphical interpretation of the result is performed. Information distribution curves are plotted on the graph.

data.name: label27.Text
data.value: Model parameters:

data.name: label29.Text
data.value: The derivative of the threshold function among the members of the first subgroup who are most open to information plays a key role in the outcome of the information dissemination process. In this example, the threshold functions f1 and f2 are chosen in such a way that information is distributed across groups in such a way that for the first group this leads to a non-zero number of adherents, for the second group information is distributed only through pre-adepts.

data.name: label30.Text
data.value: Model parameters:

data.name: label32.Text
data.value: A large value of the threshold function (~ equal to the number of group members) indicates that each group member is ready become an adept, for the second group we see that almost the entire group became adepts, only a small part (Arising due to the intensity of forgetting information by adepts) remained pre-adepts. In the first group, due to the too low value of f-tion f1 - Number of people ready to become adherents, the entire group became pre-adepts due to the high intensity of information dissemination.

data.name: label33.Text
data.value: Exercise: By changing the model parameters - a, b, d, y, as well as functions f1 and f2, obtain a system in which, the number of adherents and pre-adepts in each group is not zero
